front.title: Proceedings of the 2015 International Symposium on Forensic Science Error Management

author.organization: National Institute of Standards and Technology (U.S.)

front.abstract: A total of 432 registered participants from 11 countries contributed to a successful first-ever international symposium devoted exclusively to the topic of forensic science error management. Over the three-and-a-half day meeting and across 8 technical tracks and 42 sessions, there were 2 keynote and 10 plenary speakers, 106 oral presentations, 9 panel discussions, and 18 poster presentations. In their keynote address, Brandon Mayfield and Steven Wax, Mr. Mayfield's attorney, providing a gripping tale of the impact that an error in a fingerprint "match" caused Mr. Mayfield and his family. The symposium concluded with a moot court drama and Professor Bill Thompson serving as a "widget identification expert." Science magazine (31 July 2015 issue, 349: 462-463) even ran a short summary of the symposium.
